key_title: Key to the genera of Geraniaceae

Key to the families of Dicotyledons

source.author: Smith, L.P.; Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Geraniaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Smith, L.P.; Walsh, N.G. (1999). Geraniaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Inflorescences umbellate, at least some more than 2-flowered; flowers regular or zygomorphic with 3–8 fertile stamens; mericarps with awns c. plumose on inner surface, separating from stylar column at maturity

Inflorescences 1- or 2-flowered; flowers regular, with all 10 stamens fertile; mericarps with awns glabrous or very shortly pubescent on inner surface, rolled upwards and usually remaining attached at apex of stylar column at maturity
Flowers regular; sepals not prolonged into a spur; fertile stamens 5; mericarps sharp-pointed at base, lower part of awn tightly twisted at maturity

Flowers zygomorphic, the 2 upper petals differently shaped from, and mostly larger than, the 3 lower ones; uppermost sepal produced downwards into a nectary spur adnate to the pedicel (sometimes indistinct, and appearing as a small swelling on the pedicel); fertile stamens 3–8; mericarps obtuse to acute but not sharp-pointed at base, awns loosely spiralled at maturity
